result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oscar Y Leiva Garcia

Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. Interpreter: Vicki Bermudez, DS.  The State is waiting for an update on the Milwaukee Co. case.  Defense has the blood results from Milwaukee and will email them to ADA Van Schyndel.  BTC: Court will set 468 for trial, All Motions in Limine, Witness lists, Proposed Jury Instructions and changes to the Substantive Jury Instructions are due 48  hours before the Final Pretrial. records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: atty Luening

Adjustment Number: 22A 246515,
Payable Number: 454314,
Receipt Number: 22R 003736F,
Amount: $20.00

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim M.P (person, property, residence or family).

1:45 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Oscar Y Leiva Garcia appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening appeared by video for Oscar Y Leiva Garcia. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Finding of good cause of waive time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
